content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the code to do it:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[1], "y%m") |> Vector{String} .|> x -> parse(Int64,x)
end

# usage
add_yearmonth(df) # assuming df is the DataFrame you're working with
```
In this function `add_yearmonth`, we use `Dates.format` to format each DateTime in the column `dt`. This returns a String that represents the year and month of the DateTime, separated by `-`. We then pipe these Strings into `Vector{String} .|> x -> parse(Int64,x)` which converts these strings into integers.

Note: Make sure to replace `df` with your DataFrame's name in usage section as mentioned above.
